articles.headline: 2 Poker Sites Will Forfeit Millions
articles.snippet: PokerStars and Full Tilt Poker had been charged with bank fraud and money laundering, and some of the settlement money will be used to reimburse gamblers.
articles.abstract: PokerStars and Full Tilt Poker had been charged with bank fraud and money laundering, and some of the settlement money will be used to reimburse gamblers.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Two of the world’s largest poker companies agreed to pay hundreds of millions of dollars, some of it to be reimbursed to online gamblers, to settle federal money laundering and fraud charges, the United States attorney for the Southern District of New York said Tuesday.

articles.headline: Tea Party Favorite Wins Texas Runoff
articles.snippet: Ted Cruz defeated David Dewhurst, the candidate favored by Gov. Rick Perry, in a vote for the Republican Senate nomination.
articles.abstract: Ted Cruz defeated David Dewhurst, the candidate favored by Gov. Rick Perry, in a vote for the Republican Senate nomination.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Ted Cruz, an insurgent backed by the Tea Party, easily defeated the candidate favored by Gov. Rick Perry on Tuesday in a runoff election for the Republican Senate nomination that revealed a wide rift in Texas between the party establishment and restless anti-incumbent activists on the right.

articles.headline: Strong Yen Is Dividing Generations in Japan
articles.snippet: The rapidly expanding number of Japanese retirees benefit from the currency’s rise, but it has made the country’s exports expensive abroad.
articles.abstract: The rapidly expanding number of Japanese retirees benefit from the currency’s rise, but it has made the country’s exports expensive abroad.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHIZUOKA, Japan — As Japan has ceded dominance in industry after industry that once lifted this nation to economic greatness, there has been plenty of blame to go around. A nuclear disaster that raised energy costs. A lack of entrepreneurship. China’s relatively cheap work force.

articles.headline: Economic Thinkers Try to Solve the Euro Puzzle
articles.snippet: Europe’s financial difficulties have created the opportunity of a lifetime for ambitious idea merchants looking for fame.
articles.abstract: Europe’s financial difficulties have created the opportunity of a lifetime for ambitious idea merchants looking for fame.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Most people have heard of the Marshall Plan. Some might even know what Brady bonds are. But they have not yet heard of the Brunnermeier plan. Or Bishop bonds. Or the Gros accord.

articles.headline: New Polls in Three Battleground States Show Obama Edge
articles.snippet: Despite an advantage on the economy for Mitt Romney, personal appeal is helping President Obama, according to Quinnipiac University/New York Times/CBS News surveys.
articles.abstract: Despite an advantage on the economy for Mitt Romney, personal appeal is helping President Obama, according to Quinnipiac University/New York Times/CBS News surveys.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Obama is struggling to convince voters that he deserves to win re-election based on his handling of the economy, but his empathy and personal appeal give him an edge over Mitt Romney in Ohio, Florida and Pennsylvania, according to Quinnipiac University/New York Times/CBS News polls.
articles.byline: By Jeff Zeleny and Dalia Sussman

articles.headline: U.S. and Israel Intensify Talks on Iran Options
articles.snippet: Officials say they remain hopeful that Israel has no imminent plans to attack Iran and may be willing to let the United States take the lead in any future strike.
articles.abstract: Officials say they remain hopeful that Israel has no imminent plans to attack Iran and may be willing to let the United States take the lead in any future strike.
articles.lead_paragraph: ASHKELON, Israel — A series of public statements and private communications from the Israeli leadership in recent weeks set off renewed concerns in the Obama administration that Israel might be preparing a unilateral military strike on Iran, perhaps as early as this fall.
articles.byline: By Elisabeth Bumiller and Jodi Rudoren

articles.headline: Fleet Sales Stall, and Automakers Report Results That Are Mixed
articles.snippet: General Motors and Ford reported a drop in July sales compared with a year ago, citing lower volume to rental fleets, while Chrysler posted a 13 percent increase.
articles.abstract: General Motors and Ford reported a drop in July sales compared with a year ago, citing lower volume to rental fleets, while Chrysler posted a 13 percent increase.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — Auto sales in the United States cooled off in July as the two biggest American carmakers, General Motors and the Ford Motor Company, reported declines that they attributed partly to lower sales to rental car fleets.
